architectures.name: Enterprise-grade AKS Cluster With Private Networking And WAF
architectures.pattern_name: Enterprise-grade AKS Cluster With Private Networking And WAF
architectures.description: Enterprise chat applications let employees interact with AI agents through natural language conversations. These applications use language models, like OpenAI GPT models, and open-source development kits, like the Microsoft Foundry SDKs or the Microsoft Agent Framework. These chat applications typically consist of the following components:

architectures.name: Zone-redundant Article Layout With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Zone-redundant Article Layout With Private Networking
architectures.description: This article is part of a series that builds on the Baseline Microsoft Foundry chat reference architecture. Review the baseline architecture so that you can identify necessary adjustments before you deploy it in an Azure application landing zone subscription.

architectures.name: Production-ready App Service Web Application With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Production-ready App Service Web Application With Private Networking
architectures.description: This article provides a basic architecture to help you learn how to run chat applications by using Microsoft Foundry and Azure OpenAI in Foundry Models. The architecture includes a client user interface (UI) that runs in Azure App Service. To fetch grounding data for the language model, the UI uses an agent hosted in Foundry Agent Service to orchestrate the workflow from incoming prompts to data stores. The architecture runs in a single region.

architectures.name: Mission-critical Key Design Decisions With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Mission-critical Key Design Decisions With Private Networking
architectures.description: This article describes how to implement a medallion lakehouse design pattern for a solution-focused use case. The solution uses a hub-and-spoke network topology with landing zones that follow the Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure best practices.

architectures.name: Highly Available Learn About Databases
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Learn About Databases
architectures.description: This article provides an overview of the Azure database solutions described in Azure Architecture Center.

architectures.name: Highly Available App Service Web Application
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available App Service Web Application
architectures.description: This article describes a high-availability blue/green deployment solution for applications on Azure Spring Apps.
extraction_warnings: No browse tags from YML metadata

architectures.name: Zone-redundant Data Pipeline With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Zone-redundant Data Pipeline With Private Networking
architectures.description: This example workload illustrates a greenfield solution for creating a scalable data platform by using Microsoft Fabric and the lakehouse design paradigm. Fabric is a platform that integrates data storage, processing, and analytics. A greenfield lakehouse provides a clean start for designing an efficient, future-proof data ecosystem.

architectures.name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Ingress And Caching
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Ingress And Caching
architectures.description: This scenario illustrates how to design and implement network concepts for deploying Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) nodes on AKS clusters.
extraction_warnings: No browse tags from YML metadata

architectures.name: IOT Solution With Global Load Balancing
architectures.pattern_name: IOT Solution With Global Load Balancing
architectures.description: This article provides an overview of the measure and control process loop architecture, characteristics, and components.

architectures.name: Highly Available Architecture Notes With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Architecture Notes With Private Networking
architectures.description: This architecture is for global, internet-facing applications that use HTTP(S) and non-HTTP(S) protocols. It features DNS-based global load balancing, two forms of regional load balancing, and global virtual network peering to create a high availability architecture that can withstand a regional outage. Traffic inspection is provided by both Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) and Azure Firewall.

architectures.name: Baseline AKS Cluster With Gitops
architectures.pattern_name: Baseline AKS Cluster With Gitops
architectures.description: This reference architecture describes how Azure Arc extends Kubernetes cluster management and configuration across customer datacenters, edge locations, and multiple cloud environments.

architectures.name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Gitops
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Gitops
architectures.description: This reference architecture illustrates how to use Azure Arc for management, maintenance, and monitoring of SQL Server instances in on-premises and multicloud environments.

architectures.name: Highly Available Cloud Workload With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Cloud Workload With Private Networking
architectures.description: This architecture shows how to include Azure file shares in your hybrid environment. Azure file shares are used as serverless file shares. By integrating them with Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS), you can control and limit access to AD DS users. Azure file shares then can replace traditional file servers.

architectures.name: Event-driven System With Private Networking And Caching
architectures.pattern_name: Event-driven System With Private Networking And Caching
architectures.description: This reference architecture illustrates an enterprise-level cloud file sharing solution that uses Azure services including Azure Files, Azure File Sync, Azure Private DNS, and Azure Private Endpoint. The solution generates cost savings by outsourcing the management of file servers and infrastructure while retaining control of the data.

architectures.name: Mission-critical Article Layout With Private Networking And Caching
architectures.pattern_name: Mission-critical Article Layout With Private Networking And Caching
architectures.description: This baseline reference architecture provides workload-agnostic guidance and recommendations for configuring Azure Local 2311 and later infrastructure, to provide a reliable platform for highly available virtualized and containerized workloads. This architecture describes the resource components and cluster design choices for the physical machines that provide local compute, storage, and networking capabilities. It also describes how to use Azure services to simplify the day-to-day management of

architectures.name: Highly Available AKS Cluster
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available AKS Cluster
architectures.description: This article is part of a series that builds on the Azure Local baseline reference architecture. To effectively deploy Azure Local by using a storage switchless design, it's important to understand the baseline architecture. This process requires you to familiarize yourself with the cluster design choices for the physical nodes that deliver local compute, storage, and networking capabilities. This knowledge helps you identify the necessary changes for a successful deployment. The guidance in thi

architectures.name: Vm-based Workload With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Vm-based Workload With Private Networking
architectures.description: This reference architecture illustrates how to design a hybrid Domain Name System (DNS) solution to resolve names for workloads that are hosted on-premises and in Microsoft Azure. This architecture works for users and other systems that are connecting from on-premises and the public internet.

architectures.name: Highly Available IOT Solution With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available IOT Solution With Private Networking
architectures.description: This reference architecture illustrates how to use Azure File Sync and Azure Files to extend file services hosting capabilities across cloud and on-premises file share resources.

architectures.name: AKS Cluster
architectures.pattern_name: AKS Cluster
architectures.description: This reference architecture shows how to use Azure Monitor to monitor the performance and availability of operating system (OS) workloads that run in virtual machines (VMs). The VMs can be in Microsoft Azure, in on-premises environments, or in non-Azure clouds.

architectures.name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Private Networking
architectures.description: This reference architecture implements a hub-spoke network pattern with customer-managed hub infrastructure components. For a Microsoft-managed hub infrastructure solution, see Hub-spoke network topology with Azure Virtual WAN.

architectures.name: Mission-critical AKS Cluster With Private Networking And Geo-redundancy
architectures.pattern_name: Mission-critical AKS Cluster With Private Networking And Geo-redundancy
architectures.description: This architecture shows how the Raincode COBOL compiler modernizes mainframe legacy applications by migrating and integrating them with a modern, Azure-based technology stack without changing a single line of code. With Raincode's compiler technology, you can keep current optimized mainframe applications and deploy them on the cloud, allowing you to preserve decades of development while improving performance and flexibility. Raincode's solution is aimed at transforming the mainframe to an Azure-

architectures.name: Cloud Workload With Zero Trust
architectures.pattern_name: Cloud Workload With Zero Trust
architectures.description: This article provides AWS identity architects, administrators, and security analysts with immediate insights and detailed guidance to deploy Microsoft Entra identity and access solutions for AWS. You can configure and test these Microsoft security solutions without affecting your existing identity providers and AWS account users until you're ready to switch.

architectures.name: Mission-critical AKS Cluster With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Mission-critical AKS Cluster With Private Networking
architectures.description: This article provides a recommended baseline infrastructure architecture to deploy an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster. It follows our design principles and aligns with AKS architectural best practices from the Azure Well-Architected Framework. The article guides multiple distinct interdisciplinary groups, like networking, security, and identity teams, when they deploy this general-purpose infrastructure.

architectures.name: Baseline AKS Cluster With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Baseline AKS Cluster With Private Networking
architectures.description: This reference architecture describes several configurations to consider when you run microservices on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). This article discusses network policy configuration, pod autoscaling, and distributed tracing across a microservice-based application.

architectures.name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Zero Trust
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Zero Trust
architectures.description: This architecture shows a microservices application deployed to Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). It describes a basic AKS configuration that you can use as the starting point for most deployments. This article assumes that you have a basic understanding of Kubernetes. It highlights the infrastructure and developer operations (DevOps) aspects of how to manage microservices on AKS. For production deployments, this architecture recommends that you use Azure CNI powered by Cilium as the networking so

architectures.name: Serverless Application
architectures.pattern_name: Serverless Application
architectures.description: This reference architecture shows an end-to-end stream processing pipeline. The pipeline ingests data from two sources, correlates records in the two streams, and calculates a rolling average across a time window. The results are stored for further analysis.

architectures.name: Baseline Vm-based Workload With Global Load Balancing
architectures.pattern_name: Baseline Vm-based Workload With Global Load Balancing
architectures.description: This reference architecture shows a secure hybrid network that extends an on-premises network to Azure. The architecture implements a perimeter network, also called a DMZ, between the on-premises network and an Azure virtual network. All inbound and outbound traffic passes through Azure Firewall.

architectures.name: Multi-region App Service Web Application With Caching
architectures.pattern_name: Multi-region App Service Web Application With Caching
architectures.description: This reference architecture uses [Azure Integration Services][integration-services] to orchestrate calls to enterprise backend systems. The backend systems can include software as a service (SaaS) systems, Azure services, and existing web services in your enterprise.

architectures.name: Highly Available Vm-based Workload With Active-active
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Vm-based Workload With Active-active
architectures.description: This reference architecture shows how to connect an on-premises network to an Azure virtual network by using Azure ExpressRoute, with a site-to-site virtual private network (VPN) as a failover connection.

architectures.name: Mission-critical VPN Connection
architectures.pattern_name: Mission-critical VPN Connection
architectures.description: This article compares three options for connecting an on-premises network to an Azure Virtual Network (VNet). For each option, a more detailed reference architecture is available.

architectures.name: Highly Available Virtual Network Connection Types
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Virtual Network Connection Types
architectures.description: This article compares two ways to connect virtual networks in Azure: virtual network peering and virtual private network (VPN) gateways. It also explores spoke-to-spoke communication patterns for hub-and-spoke architectures to help you choose the optimal approach for your networking requirements.

architectures.name: Cloud Workload
architectures.pattern_name: Cloud Workload
architectures.description: This reference architecture shows how to create a separate Active Directory domain in Azure that is trusted by domains in your on-premises Active Directory forest.

architectures.name: Highly Available Cloud Workload
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Cloud Workload
architectures.description: This reference architecture implements a secure hybrid network that extends your on-premises network to Azure and uses [Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS)][active-directory-federation-services] to perform federated authentication and authorization for components that run in Azure.

architectures.name: Highly Available Vm-based Workload
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Vm-based Workload
architectures.description: Microsoft Entra ID is a cloud-based directory and identity service. This reference architecture shows best practices for integrating on-premises Active Directory domains with Microsoft Entra ID to provide cloud-based identity authentication.

architectures.name: Highly Available Serverless Application With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Serverless Application With Private Networking
architectures.description: This example architecture outlines an implementation plan to replicate and sync data during modernization to Azure. It describes technical aspects like data stores, tools, and services.

architectures.name: Mission-critical AKS Cluster With Private Networking And Active-active
architectures.pattern_name: Mission-critical AKS Cluster With Private Networking And Active-active
architectures.description: This article describes how to use Avanade Automated Migration Technology (AMT) to migrate Unisys Master Control Program (MCP) source code and emulated MCP systems to the Azure cloud.

architectures.name: Highly Available Vm-based Workload With WAF And Geo-redundancy
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Vm-based Workload With WAF And Geo-redundancy
architectures.description: Provisioning a virtual machine (VM) in Azure requires additional components besides the VM itself, including networking and storage resources. This article shows best practices for running a secure Linux VM on Azure.

architectures.name: Highly Available Serverless Application With WAF And Caching
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available Serverless Application With WAF And Caching
architectures.description: The following example focuses specifically on the SAP BW/4HANA application tier. It's suitable for a small-scale production environment of SAP BW/4HANA on Azure, where high availability is a priority.

architectures.name: Enterprise-grade Vm-based Workload With Caching
architectures.pattern_name: Enterprise-grade Vm-based Workload With Caching
architectures.description: This reference architecture shows a set of proven practices for running SAP HANA in a highly available, scale-up environment that supports disaster recovery on Azure. This implementation focuses on the database layer only.

architectures.name: Mission-critical Article Layout With Private Networking And WAF
architectures.pattern_name: Mission-critical Article Layout With Private Networking And WAF
architectures.description: This article provides a foundational reference architecture for a workload deployed on Azure Virtual Machines.

architectures.name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available AKS Cluster With Private Networking
architectures.description: Organizations increasingly adopt API-first design approaches while facing growing threats to web applications. You need a comprehensive security strategy to protect APIs, especially when exposing AI-powered APIs and implementing zero trust architecture principles. The Gateway Routing pattern provides one approach to API security by protecting network traffic. The gateway restricts traffic source locations and traffic quality while supporting flexible routing rules. This article describes how to

architectures.name: Highly Available App Service Web Application
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available App Service Web Application
architectures.description: This baseline architecture builds on the basic web application architecture and provides detailed guidance for designing a secure, zone-redundant, and highly available web app on Azure. In this architecture, Azure Application Gateway with Azure Web Application Firewall exposes a public endpoint and routes requests to Azure App Service through Azure Private Link. The App Service application uses virtual network integration and Private Link to communicate securely with Azure platform as a service

architectures.name: Production-ready Container Apps Deployment With Private Networking
architectures.pattern_name: Production-ready Container Apps Deployment With Private Networking
architectures.description: This article provides a basic architecture to help you learn about running web applications on Azure App Service in a single region.

architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available App Service Web Application
architectures.description:
> [!NOTE]

architectures.name: Highly Available App Service Web Application
architectures.pattern_name: Highly Available App Service Web Application
architectures.description: This reference architecture demonstrates a common enterprise workload that uses Azure App Service Environment version 3. It also describes best practices for strengthening the security of the workload.
